standard_metadata.standard_description: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication to multiply a fraction by a whole number.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Multiply mixed numbers and whole numbers

hints.content: First, let's turn our mixed number into a fraction.   $\begin{align} \greenD2\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{5}}&= \greenD1 ~+ ~\greenD1~+~\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{5}}\\\\ &=\greenD{\dfrac{5}{5}} + \greenD{\dfrac{5}{5}} + \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{5}}\\\\ &=\dfrac{12}{5} \end{align}$
Now, let's multiply our fraction by $4$.  $\dfrac{12}{5} \times 4 = \dfrac{12}{5} + \dfrac{12}{5} +  \dfrac{12}{5} + \dfrac{12}{5} = \dfrac{48}{5}$

We can rewrite $\dfrac{48}{5}$ as a mixed number.  $\begin{align} \dfrac{48}{5}&=  \greenD{\dfrac{5}{5}} + \greenD{\dfrac{5}{5}} +   \greenD{\dfrac{5}{5}} +\greenD{\dfrac{5}{5}} +\greenD{\dfrac{5}{5}} +\greenD{\dfrac{5}{5}} +\greenD{\dfrac{5}{5}} +\greenD{\dfrac{5}{5}} +\greenD{\dfrac{5}{5}} +  \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{5}}  \\\\ &=\greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+\greenD1 ~+ \greenD1 ~+ \greenD1 ~+\greenD1 +~ \greenD1 +~ \greenD1 +~ \greenD1 + \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{5}}\\\\ &=\greenD9 \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{5}} \end{align}$
The product can be expressed in the following ways:  - $\dfrac{48}{5} $  - $9 \dfrac{3}{5}$

First, let's turn our mixed number into a fraction.   $\begin{align} \greenD2\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{3}}&= \greenD1 ~+  ~\greenD1 ~+ ~\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{3}}\\\\ &=\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}}  + \greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} + \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{3}}\\\\ &=\dfrac{7}{3} \end{align}$
Now, let's multiply our fraction by $3$.  $\dfrac{7}{3} \times 3 = \dfrac{7}{3} + \dfrac{7}{3} +  \dfrac{7}{3} = \dfrac{21}{3}$

We can rewrite $\dfrac{21}{3}$ as a whole number.  $\begin{align} \dfrac{21}{3}&=  \greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} + \greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +   \greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}}  \\\\ &=\greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1\\\\ &=\greenD7 \end{align}$
The product can be expressed in the following ways:   - $\dfrac{21}{3} $  - $7$

First, let's turn our mixed number into a fraction.   $\begin{align} \greenD1\maroonD{\dfrac{5}{12}}&= \greenD1 ~+~\maroonD{\dfrac{5}{12}}\\\\ &=\greenD{\dfrac{12}{12}} + \maroonD{\dfrac{5}{12}}\\\\ &=\dfrac{17}{12} \end{align}$
Now, let's multiply our fraction by $2$.  $\dfrac{17}{12} \times 2 = \dfrac{17}{12} + \dfrac{17}{12}  = \dfrac{34}{12}$

We can rewrite $\dfrac{34}{12}$ as a mixed number.  $\begin{align} \dfrac{34}{12}&=  \greenD{\dfrac{12}{12}} + \greenD{\dfrac{12}{12}} + \maroonD{\dfrac{10}{12}}  \\\\ &= \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 + \maroonD{\dfrac{10}{12}}\\\\ &=\greenD2 \maroonD{\dfrac{10}{12}} \end{align}$
The product can be expressed in the following ways:  * $\dfrac{34}{12} $  * $\dfrac{17}{6} $  - $2 \dfrac{10}{12}$   * $2 \dfrac{5}{6}$

First, let's turn our mixed number into a fraction.   $\begin{align} \greenD1\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}}&= \greenD1 ~+~\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}}\\\\ &=\greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}}\\\\ &=\dfrac{7}{4} \end{align}$
Now, let's multiply our fraction by $5$.  $\dfrac{7}{4} \times 5 = \dfrac{7}{4} + \dfrac{7}{4} +\dfrac{7}{4} + \dfrac{7}{4} +\dfrac{7}{4}  = \dfrac{35}{4}$

We can rewrite $\dfrac{35}{4}$ as a mixed number.  $\begin{align} \dfrac{35}{4}&=  \greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} + \greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +   \greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +\greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +\greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +\greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +\greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +\greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +   \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}}  \\\\ &=\greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 + \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}}\\\\ &=\greenD8 \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}} \end{align}$
The product can be expressed in the following ways:  - $\dfrac{35}{4} $  - $8 \dfrac{3}{4}$

First, let's turn our mixed number into a fraction.   $\begin{align} \greenD2\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{2}}&= \greenD1 ~+~\greenD1 ~+~\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{2}}\\\\ &=\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} + \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +  \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{2}}\\\\ &=\dfrac{5}{2} \end{align}$
Now, let's multiply our fraction by $4$.  $\dfrac{5}{2} \times 4=\dfrac{5}{2} + \dfrac {5}{2} + \dfrac{5}{2} +\dfrac{5}{2}  = \dfrac{20}{2}$

We can rewrite $\dfrac{20}{2}$ as a whole number.  $\begin{align} \dfrac{20}{2}&=  \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} + \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +   \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +   \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}}  \\\\ &=\greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~  \greenD1\\\\ &=\greenD{10} \end{align}$
The product can be expressed in the following ways:  - $\dfrac{20}{2} $  - $10$

First, let's turn our mixed number into a fraction.   $\begin{align} \greenD2\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}}&= \greenD1 ~+~\greenD1 ~+~\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}}\\\\ &=\greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} + \greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} + \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}}\\\\ &=\dfrac{11}{4} \end{align}$
Now, let's multiply our fraction by $2$.  $\dfrac{11}{4} \times 2 = \dfrac{11}{4} + \dfrac{11}{4}  = \dfrac{22}{4}$

We can rewrite $\dfrac{22}{4}$ as a mixed number.  $\begin{align} \dfrac{22}{4}&=  \greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} + \greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +   \greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +\greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +\greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}}  \\\\ &=\greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 + \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}} \\\\ &=\greenD5 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}} \end{align}$
The product can be expressed in the following ways:  - $\dfrac{22}{4} $  - $\dfrac{11}{2}$  - $5 \dfrac12$  - $5\dfrac24$

First, let's turn our mixed number into a fraction.  $\begin{align} \greenD4\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{2}}&= \greenD1 ~+ \greenD1~ + \greenD1 + ~\greenD1 + ~\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{2}}\\\\ &=\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} + \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}}  + \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}}  + \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}}  + \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{2}}\\\\ &=\dfrac{9}{2} \end{align}$
Now, let's multiply our fraction by $2$.  $\dfrac{9}{2} \times 2 = \dfrac{9}{2} + \dfrac{9}{2} = \dfrac{18}{2}$

We can rewrite $\dfrac{18}{2}$ as a whole number.  $\begin{align} \dfrac{18}{2}&=  \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} + \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +   \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +   \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}}  \\\\ &=\greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1\\\\ &=\greenD9  \end{align}$
We can express the product in the following ways:  - $\dfrac{18}{2}$  - ${9}$

First, let's turn our mixed number into a fraction.  $\begin{align} \greenD2\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{4}}&= \greenD1 ~+~\greenD1 ~+ \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{4}}\\\\ &=\greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} + \greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} + \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{4}}\\\\ &=\dfrac{9}{4} \end{align}$
Now, let's multiply our fraction by $3$.  $\dfrac{9}{4} \times 3 = \dfrac{9}{4} + \dfrac{9}{4} + \dfrac{9}{4} = \dfrac{27}{4}$

We can rewrite $\dfrac{27}{4}$ as a mixed number.  $\begin{align} \dfrac{27}{4}&=  \greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} + \greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +   \greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +\greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +\greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +\greenD{\dfrac{4}{4}} +\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}}  \\\\ &=\greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 + \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}} \\ &=\greenD6 \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}} \end{align}$
We can express the product in the following ways:  - $\dfrac{27}{4} $  - $6 \dfrac{3}{4}$

First, let's turn our mixed number into a fraction.  $\begin{align} \greenD1\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{8}}&= \greenD1 ~ + ~\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{8}}\\\\ &=\greenD{\dfrac{8}{8}} + \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{8}}\\\\ &=\dfrac{11}{8} \end{align}$
Now, let's multiply our fraction by $4$.  $\dfrac{11}{8} \times 4 = \dfrac{11}{8} + \dfrac{11}{8} + \dfrac{11}{8} + \dfrac{11}{8} = \dfrac{44}{8}= \dfrac{11}{2}$

We can rewrite $\dfrac{11}{2}$ as a mixed number.  $\begin{align} \dfrac{11}{2}&=  \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +   \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{2}}  \\\\ &=\greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 + \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{2}} \\\\ &=\greenD5 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{2}} \end{align}$
We can express the product in the following ways:  - $\dfrac{11}{2} $  - $5 \dfrac{1}{2}$

First, let's turn our mixed number into a fraction.   $\begin{align} \greenD3\maroonD{\dfrac{5}{6}}&= \greenD1 ~+~\greenD1 ~+ \greenD1~+~\maroonD{\dfrac{5}{6}}\\\\ &=\greenD{\dfrac{6}{6}} + \greenD{\dfrac{6}{6}} + \greenD{\dfrac{6}{6}}  + \maroonD{\dfrac{5}{6}}\\\\ &=\dfrac{23}{6} \end{align}$
Now, let's multiply our fraction by $2$.  $\dfrac{23}{6} \times 2 = \dfrac{23}{6} + \dfrac{23}{6} = \dfrac{46}{6} = \dfrac{23}{3}$

We can rewrite $\dfrac{23}{3}$ as a mixed number.  $\begin{align} \dfrac{23}{3}&=  \greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +   \greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +   \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{3}}  \\\\ &=\greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~  \greenD1 + \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{3}}\\\\ &= \greenD7 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{3}} \end{align}$
We can express the product in the following ways:  - $\dfrac{23}{3} $  - $7 \dfrac{2}{3}$

First, let's turn our mixed number into a fraction.   $\begin{align} \greenD1\maroonD{\dfrac{7}{10}}&= \greenD1 ~+~\maroonD{\dfrac{7}{10}}\\\\ &=\greenD{\dfrac{10}{10}} + \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{10}}\\\\ &=\dfrac{17}{10} \end{align}$
Now, let's multiply our fractions by $5$.  $\dfrac{17}{10} \times 5 = \dfrac{17}{10} + \dfrac{17}{10} +\dfrac{17}{10} +\dfrac{17}{10} + \dfrac{17}{10} = \dfrac{85}{10} =  \dfrac{17}{2}$

We can rewrite $\dfrac{17}{2}$ as a mixed number.  $\begin{align} \dfrac{17}{2}&=  \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} + \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +   \greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +\greenD{\dfrac{2}{2}} +   \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{2}}  \\\\ &=\greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 +\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{2}}\\\\ &= \greenD8 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{2}} \end{align}$
We can express the product in the following ways:  - $\dfrac{17}{2} $  - $8 \dfrac{1}{2}$

First, let's turn our mixed number into a fraction.   $\begin{align} \greenD2\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{3}}&= \greenD1 ~+ ~\greenD1~+~\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{3}}\\\\ &=\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} + \greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} + \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{3}}\\\\ &=\dfrac{8}{3} \end{align}$
Now, let's multiply our fraction by $3$.  $\dfrac{8}{3} \times 3 = \dfrac{8}{3} + \dfrac{8}{3} + \dfrac{8}{3} = \dfrac{24}{3}$

We can rewrite $\dfrac{24}{3}$ as a whole number.  $\begin{align} \dfrac{24}{3}&=  \greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +\greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}} +   \greenD{\dfrac{3}{3}}  \\\\ &=\greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~ \greenD1 ~+~  \greenD1\\\\ &=\greenD{8} \end{align}$
We can express the product in the following ways:  - $\dfrac{24}{3} $  - $8$
